captions.text:
I just found out I have to
cancel my party tonight.
I was so looking forward to you coming.

- It was gonna be so fun.
- I know.
All right, I gotta go get things straight.
- Then this icicle just snaps off the roof

and shatters all around us.
- No way, oh my god.

- And everybody jumps (voice
muffled) from the noise.
- Can we just stay in tonight?
- No, you need to calm down.

- [Sara] I just wanna smell
them, I don't wanna eat them.

- [Ashly] Oh, the box
just smells like cardboard.

with it when I was younger and most of high school but it started becoming 
tough in university and even more at work. It's like I HAVE to put on this 
fake smile and pretend like I'm outgoing just so I don't look bitchy at 
work and keep good work relations with my coworkers. It's so tiring :(.. 
Especially when I SUCK at small talk and starting conversations. So I only 
say hi to my coworkers and smile but it feels like I should say more? And I 
absolutely dread when my coworkers ask me what I'm doing for special 
occasions like New Year's or my birthday since they expect me to go out 
partying but I'd rather do something more relaxing with a handful of 
friends. I feel like everyone at my work is a lot more outgoing than I am 
and I'm the only introverted one. In short, I wish I could be more 
confident about being an introvert and just OWN it!﻿

comments.text:
*Things that suck about being introverted AND/OR shy:*

When someone asks you to go to a big party and you can't just say no so you 
end up (very reluctantly) going.

When your teacher tells you to get in groups so you look around for your 
friends (if you have any) but their group is already full so you end up 
being the last one with no group and your teacher assigns it for you, to a 
group of people you don't like or don't know.

When you ask to work alone, and your teacher says,"no".

And then when your teacher questions why you always want to work alone 
meanwhile giving you their face of pity.

When people see you sitting alone (like at lunch or something) and ask if 
you wanna sit with them. (Like it's nice a nice gesture and all but FUCK 
THT! Talking to a group of strangers without anyone you know...(shivers)

When your friends are going on about some boring ass conversation that you 
can't follow and you're so tempted to just stick your headphones on and 
drown in the music.

Meeting your friend's friends.

When people tell you "Don't be shy"

When people ask "Why are you always so quiet?"

When you get caught trying to avoid conversing with someone.

When you go to family dinners and you don't really get along with any 
family members your age so you just sit there at the dinner table with your 
headphones in. And then when you tell your parent "I don't wanna go to 
family dinners anymore." They force you to go even though they always make 
you feel awkward, bored, and like they're are a waste of time if your not 
having fun. Just me? Okay):

When someone continuously tries to talk to you EVEN THOUGH you have your 
headphones on. (My mom does this ALL the time, omg it gets seriously 
annoying)

When you get so pissed and yell profanities in the middle of a class (and 
really loud), then everyone looks at you, bewildered that you even spoke 
let alone yelled swear words. Actually this one I find funny. :D I love 
their shocked faces HA~!

When you *want* to date someone but are too afraid to actually *go* on a 
date with ANYONE so you just give up on love (waves forever alone flag~) XD 
 
This last one might be just me but:
When your forced to share your very personal (and very cheesy) feelings out 
loud to someone but once you do you get this feeling of disgust. Like your 
grossing yourself out. I think I'm much like a guy in sharing feelings and 
stuff. Ugh I hate it, it's disgusting. And I know it's bad to think that 
way, but eww.﻿

comments.author: LucyLAL100

comments.text:
+LucyLAL100 

They're outdated terms from the field of psychology, would I call them 
scientific? Perhaps, if you accept that they can't be quantified or 
measured accurately. Either way, the point is that by labeling yourself as 
an introvert or extrovert you become stuck into a frame of mind that limits 
your happiness and personal satisfaction. People can become introverted 
through self esteem issues, and by characterising themselves as introverts 
they limit their options and excuse their reluctance to face their self 
esteem issues.

aggressive.

comments.text:
Dear Buzzfeed:
I downloaded an add-on that blocks channels.  I was looking through all 
your videos, going, "There is literally nothing that I would want to 
watch."  Until I got closer to the bottom, and saw this.  I'm an introvert, 
and this is pretty much entirely wrong and perpetuates myths about 
introverts that have been hurting us forever.  Just like EVERY OTHER VIDEO 
you guys do, you did NO RESEARCH AT ALL, or handled an issue with the least 
amount of sensitivity possible/ weren't remotely funny enough to excuse 
your insensitive approach. 
So I bid you a glee-filled goodbye forever.
PS:  To everyone else who hates BuzzFeed, just search for the add-on "Video 
Blocker", made by Lemonrice.﻿

comments.text:
I have the Holy Grail of introvert moments.  I was hiking the Appalachian 
Trail (introvert's paradise right there) and I was doing an 11 mile stretch 
to Neel's Gap.  It was pouring rain, foggy, and the sun was going down and 
I was making horrible time but I finally got to Mountain Crossings (which 
is an outfitter/hostel at Neel's Gap) but there were no more bunks 
available.  Just then, this older couple who owns some cabins about 1/4 
mile down the road said they had one left if I wanted to split it with some 
other hikers.  Long story short:  I got a hot shower, a pizza, and a Coke 
Zero and the people I split the cabin with took the bedrooms while I took 
the futon in the living room all by myself and fell asleep in front of a 
crackling fire in a log cabin with the rain pouring down outside.  And it 
was the single happiest moment of my adult life.  The end.﻿

comments.text:
I'm a big time introvert. I related to everything listed in this video. God 
yes, let me just stay home. Stranger danger still applies to me, hell I go 
into a panic attack when ever someone I don't know, so much as looks at me. 
An as for keeping in thouch with people, unless you make the first move to 
call me, we probably wont keep in thouch. (; ^ _^) Sorry guys, it's just 
the way I am, unless it's important business that I have to get a hold of 
your for, I probably wont call at all. Hell even important business 
sometimes isn't a big enough motivator. Not with strangers. "xD But if you 
call me, then I will make the time an I'm all ears.

But having said that, I'm also lazy and a talker. Being as lazy as I am, 
means I'm to lazy for long texting. I'd rather face a 5-20 min conversation 
over the phone then deal with hours, upon hours of back to back texting. 
Not cause I want to talk, but simply because I'm to lazy to talk/type for 
so long. Plus I can't stand ackward silences. So when it's quite or when no 
one says anything, I start to panic so bad my mouth moves on its own. Next 
thing you know, I turn into this person who can actually talk to people, 
just cause I'm panicing so much on the inside I need something, anything to 
make it stop. Then suddenly it's been a gap of time, I made you laugh quite 
a bit and it's over. It's finally over and all I want to do is crawl back 
in a whole and hide.

But hey, if you can get passed that part of me, all the walls and awkward 
moments, you will get to know another side of me. Someone more open and 
willing to be the friend you need, even if it takes walking out of my safe 
shell to my own living hell. (Pubic places) I'm willing to do a lot for the 
people I care about. Thank you to the people who put up with me. =D



The Ashdrew! (Squeal)﻿

comments.author: AudreyMacaroni

comments.text:
Omfg I do all of this xD here's explanation why:

Do not disturb: when I'm sat on my bed enjoys my minutes as an introvert I 
suddenly hear a slight "ding!" Me: "ugh, texts I don't care about" and do 
not disturb is just so awesome :-D 

Cancelled plans: hey, I love my introvert time. And social activities 
aren't really my thing. They're fun tho.

Avoiding conversation: I like talking to people at times. But their R times 
when I'm like "ugh, my jaw is too lazy to make any noises!" 

Books: DONT LIE! BOOKS R AWESOME! 

When no ones home: it's quiet.
Just you. Free to do whatever weird things u do alone.
Free to eat the left over snacks. Free to watch the TV on any channel. And 
best of all: no one will ever know . .

Head phones: people talk about distracting things sometimes. Also they're 
very comfortable, like earmuffs but future ear muffs ^_^ 

Rain: it's very peaceful. Just the noise of the rain outside while you're 
inside reading a book. The smoking, soggy and foggy smell of water falling 
from the sky. And best of all. Dimming the lights, lighting a single 
candle, grabbing a laptop, and watching a movie while theirs a relaxing 
thunderstorm outside .. (Also I cannot get to sleep in hot weather! Not 
ever!) 

Hiding under covers: it's just so warm and dark! So comforting .. 


I can't be the only one who has these reasons! 



﻿
